summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons Program Statement (5270.09) establishing the Inmate Discipline Program, effective August 1, 2011. It outlines prohibited acts, sanctions, and procedures for disciplinary actions against inmates in BOP custody. The document includes significant updates, such as establishing new prohibited acts for sexual assault with and without force, increasing severity levels for certain offenses, and detailing the disciplinary hearing process.

persons.name: Thomas R. Kane
persons.role: Acting Director, Federal Bureau of Prisons
persons.context: Approved the Program Statement as the Acting Director of the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

events.title: Inmate Discipline Program Effective Date

events.title: Program Statement Issuance
events.description: Program Statement 5270.09, Inmate Discipline Program, is issued by the Federal Bureau of Prisons.

keyFacts: The document establishes new Greatest and High severity level prohibited acts for sexual assault: Code 114 (with force/threat) and Code 229 (without force).
It increases the severity level of escapes from non-secure facilities and all alcohol-related offenses to Greatest severity level.
The policy formalizes the disciplinary process, including incident reports, investigations, Unit Discipline Committee (UDC) reviews, and Discipline Hearing Officer (DHO) hearings.
It mandates loss of good conduct time as a disciplinary sanction for inmates under the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act (VCCLEA) and Prison Litigation Reform Act (PLRA).
The document is a standard BOP operational policy and does not contain any specific references to Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or related individuals.
